article.headline: Southern Miss 91, William Carey 59
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Clement Carter set career highs with 30 points and 10 rebounds to lead Southern Mississippi to a 91-59 win over William Carey on Monday night. Carter finished 9-for-13 on 3-pointers with seven in the second half. Charles Gaines also had a double-double with 21 points and 10 rebounds. The Golden Eagles (6-3) led their NAIA opponent 32-22 at half before blowing the game open early in the second half. Southern Miss (6-3) extended its lead to 21 points in the first two minutes. The Golden Eagles outscored William Carey 38-7 through the 12:24 mark of the second half. Carter came up big in the run, connecting on six straight 3s. Southern Miss led by as many as 39 twice, the last coming on a 79-40 advantage with 8:58 remaining. Carter's 3-point shooting performance was the second-best in school history. Bernard Haslett has the Golden Eagles' record with 10 3-pointers against Memphis in 1993. Jaeson Maravich, the son of Hall of Famer Pete Maravich, led William Carey (3-9) with 17 points. Braxton Robins added 16. The Golden Eagles got 14 points from Jasper Johnson and 10 from Jarekus Singleton. Johnson had 10 points in the first half.
